title: Program Manager at NASA Glenn Earns AIAA Sustained Service Award
summary: Christopher Pestak, program manager of the Glenn Engineering and Research Support (GEARS) contract at NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland, has received the 2025 Sustained Service Award from the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA). This award recognizes AIAA members who have given their time, dedication, and efforts in service to AIAA, the aerospace community, […]

title: NASA Glenn’s Office of Communications Earns Top Honors
summary: NASA Glenn Research Center’s Office of Communications earned top honors — including Best in Show — during the Public Relations Society of America (PRSA)’s Cleveland Rocks Awards on Nov. 19. During the event, the PRSA Greater Cleveland chapter recognized outstanding campaigns and tactics developed in 2024 by leading public relations and communications professionals in the […]

title: An Evening With the Stars: 10 Years and Counting
summary: NASA Glenn Research Center’s “An Evening With the Stars” showcased research and technology innovations that addressed this year’s theme, NASA Glenn’s Spotlight on the Stars: 10 Years and Counting. The event featured presentations from Glenn subject matter experts and a networking reception.  Held at Windows on the River near Cleveland’s historic waterfront on Nov. 20, […]

title: NASA Partners with US Patent and Trademark Office to Advance Technology Transfer
summary: With a shared commitment to fostering U.S. economic growth that benefits the American public, NASA’s Space Technology Mission Directorate and the Department of Commerce’s U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) have signed a memorandum of understanding to strengthen collaboration in transferring federally developed technology into the private sector, known as tech transfer.  “NASA has to invent new […]

title: K2 Space lands $30 million military contract for “Mega” satellite mission
summary:
The company’s large satellite platform will travel from low to medium orbit using electric propulsion

title: Philippines team add hypergravity for stronger bone cells
summary: A team of researchers from two universities in the Philippines made use of ESA’s Large Diameter Centrifuge to test the growth of bone cells in hypergravity. The results of their experiment could help improve bone implant technology, as well as help support seaweed farming communities across the country.

title: 55 Years Ago: Apollo 13, Preparations for the Third Moon Landing
summary: As 1969, an historic year that saw not just one but two successful human lunar landings, drew to a close, NASA continued preparations for its planned third Moon landing mission, Apollo 13, then scheduled for launch on March 12, 1970. title: Vast signs agreement with SpaceX for private astronaut missions to the ISS
summary:
Commercial space station developer Vast Space signed a deal with SpaceX for two private astronaut missions to the ISS, pending NASA approval.

title: Maxar signs $35 million satellite intelligence deals in Asia-Pacific region
